data.text: @rwillowfish I thought I havenâ€™t passed it and then it appeared in a blood test that actually I did passed Covid. It was a routine test before I was admited to the mental health hospital.
@rwillowfish Sounds like you are in the clear.
@LinaBoo8 I felt some possible Covid symptoms (low fever, exhaustion, loss of taste & smell) well after that, like in winter of 2021. And I've been 3x vaxxed.

@LinaBoo8 Oh, wait, I did have 1 test in July, and 1 test in August (in 2021) prior to entering psych unit, both negative, but hadn't felt physically ill then.
And I've been mostly isolated and always masked up to go out, and live where everyone is good about masking up around others.

@LinaBoo8 No, including when I thought I might have Covid, because tests were only available by
-fighting for limited supply at library where I'd maybe be a spreader
-repeat for trying to buy tests
-appt slots filled 2 weeks out
-trying to negotiate very narrow avenues for tests while sick
@ShannonMeridian I can handle all your bitterness.
@rwillowfish Sorry, that was quite bitter. I'm having a rough day.
